sentences.sContent: His family then moved to a slightly larger house.
sentences.sCn: 他的家后来搬到了一间稍微大一点儿的房子。

sentences.sContent: Each person learns in a slightly different way.
sentences.sCn: 每个人学习的方式都略有不同。

sentences.sContent: ...But perhaps Plutarch is suggesting something slightly different...
...so I was only slightly taken aback that I had achieved perfection at the tender age of 14...
...Keep a downwind window open slightly for fresh air...
...We’re talking about gentle ways to make sugar consumption slightly less convenient...
...The chemical composition of rainfall changes slightly as raid clouds move...

words.tran: 轻微的，少量的；脆弱的；细长的；不重要的

trans.tranOther: Slightly means to some degree but not to a very large degree
